data.title: Quiz Monkey
data.text:
Married Jennifer Garner, star of TV CIA drama Alias, in 2005 (separated 2015)

Ben Affleck

Married to the actress Brooke Shields 1997–9 (tennis star)

André Agassi

George Burns's second wife (1926–64) and comedy partner

Gracie Allen

Married Soon–Yi Previn, adopted daughter of André Previn and Mia Farrow, 1991

Woody Allen

Mötley Cröe drummer Tommy Lee (1995–8), rock star Kid Rock (2006–7), poker player Rick Salomon (2007–08, 2014–2015)

Pamela Anderson

Married Katie Price (Jordan) in 2005 at Highclere Castle (Downton Abbey in the TV series) – divorced in 2009

Peter Andre

Married to film director Blake Edwards, from 1969 until his death in 2010

Julie Andrews

Former sex worker Daisy Parker (1919–23), pianist Lil Hardin (1924–38), Alpha Smith (1938–42), singer Lucille Wilson (from 1942)

Louis Armstrong

Married to former footballer Lee Chapman, since 1988

Leslie Ash

Married to Gerald Scarfe since 1981 (previously engaged to Paul McCartney, but ended the relationship in 1968 when she found him in bed with Francie Schwartz)

Jane Asher

Humphrey Bogart's wife, from 1945 until his death in 1957 (his 4th and only really famous wife, and the mother of his two children); subsequently married Jason Robards (1961–9)

Lauren Bacall

Former Bond girl, married to Ringo Starr since 1981

Barbara Bach

Married to US actress Paula Stewart (1953–8), Angie Dickinson (1965–80), lyricist Carole Bayer Sager (1982–91); and to non–celebrity Jane Hansen (from 1993)

Burt Bacharach

Married to actress Catherine Deneuve (1965–72), model Marie Helvin (1975–82)

David Bailey

Married to Kim Basinger (1993–2002)

Alec Baldwin

Married Fatboy Slim (Norman Cook) 1999

Zoe Ball

Mel Brooks's second wife (from 1964 until her death in 2005)

Anne Bancroft

Welsh–born fashion designer: married to the pop star Sandie Shaw, 1968–78

Jeff Banks

Married Penelope Cruz, 2010

Javier Bardem

Israeli pianist and conductor (born in Argentina): married to Jaqueline du Pré, from 1967 until her death in 1987 aged 42 (she was diagnosed with multiple sclerosis in 1973)

Daniel Barenboim

Husband of Labour cabinet minister Jennie Lee

Aneurin Bevan

Married to Tessa Wyatt (1972–7)

Tony Blackburn

Married Australian model Miranda Kerr in 2010 (separated in 2013)

Orlando Bloom

Married to Hugh Pollock (1924–42), Darrell Waters (from 1943, until his death in 1967; she died in 1968). Pollock was the father of her two daughters

Enid Blyton

Married to John Cleese (1968–78): appeared in some Monty Python television episodes, and in the first two films; co–wrote and co–starred in Fawlty Towers

Connie Booth

Soviet gymnast Ludmilla Tourischeva (a four–time Olympic gold medallist, 1968–76) married, in 1977 (double gold medallist in 1972)

Valeriy Borzov

Pop star who married supermodel Iman

David Bowie

Cartoonist, once married to Anna Ford

Mark Boxer (Marc)

Married to Emma Thompson, 1989–95

Kenneth Branagh

Married to Katy Perry from October 2010 to July 2012

Russell Brand

Footballer: married Frankie Sandford, of the Saturdays, in 2014

Wayne Bridge

Former model, married to Billy Joel 1985–94 (the Uptown Girl)

Christie Brinkley

Comedian and satirist: married former Blue Peter presenter Konnie Huq in 2010

Charlie Brooker

Married to Whitney Houston (1992–2007 – she died 2012)

Bobby Brown

Poet Elizabeth Barrett married (1846)

Robert Browning

Film director: married to fellow director Kathryn Bigelow (1989–91), actress Linda Hamilton (1997–9) and former actress Suzy Amis (2000 to date)

James Cameron

Johnny Cash's second wife, from 1967 until her death in 2003: country singer

June Carter

Married to her mentor, Columbia Records executive Tommy Mottola, 1993–8

Mariah Carey

Married Alexander George McCorquodale (1927–32) and his cousin Hugh McCorquodale (1936, until his death in 1963)

Barbara Cartland

Married Mildred Harris, Lita Grey, Paulette Goddard, and Oona O'Neill (daughter of the US playwright Eugene O'Neill)

Charlie Chaplin

Married to co–presenter Maggie Philbin, from 1982 until 1993

Keith Chegwin

Petitioned for divorce from Greg Allman after 10 days in 1975

Cher

Married to the archaeologist Sir Max Mallowan, from 1930 until her death in 1976

Agatha Christie

Fabric designer Celia Birtwell, 1969–74 (fashion designer)

Ossie Clark

Married to the actress Talia Balsam, 1989–93; subsequently married the London–based Lebanese–British lawyer and activist Amal Ramzi Alamuddin, in 2014 (in Venice)

George Clooney

Married Cheryl Tweedie of Girls Aloud, 2006 (divorced 2010)

Ashley Cole

Married to Kris Kristofferson, 1973–80; previously had relationships with Stephen Stills and Graham Nash, and is often held responsible for the break–up of CSN&Y

Rita Coolidge

Married to Ed Balls, since 1998 (they were the first married couple to serve together in the British cabinet)

Yvette Cooper

Married Mexican businesswoman Laura Álvarez in 2013 (his third wife – she runs a Fair Trade coffee import business)

Jeremy Corbyn

Married comedian David Mitchell in 2012

Victoria Coren

Second wife (2011 to present) is actress Rachel Weisz, who won an Oscar in 2006 for The Constant Gardener

Daniel Craig

First wife of Douglas Fairbanks Jr.

Joan Crawford

Married actresses Mimi Rogers (1987–90), Nicole Kidman (1990–2001), Katie Holmes (2006–12)

Tom Cruise

Married fellow Oscar winner Javier Bardem, 2010

Penelope Cruz

English jazz–pop musician (primarily piano), singer, songwriter and radio presenter: married model and author Sophie Dahl (granddaughter of Roald Dahl, Patrician Neal and Stanley Holloway) in 2010

Jamie Cullum

Married theatre director Sophie Hunter in 2015 (on St. Valentine's Day)

Benedict Cumberbatch

Married to Jeremy Irons from 1978 (his second wife)

Sinead Cusack

Married to the Oscar–winning US actress Patricia Neal, 1953–83 (5 children)

Roald Dahl

Married golfer Sam Torrance in 1988 (an actress; he proposed on Concorde on the way to play in the Ryder Cup)

Suzanne Danielle

Married to Cleo Laine, from 1958 until his death in 2010

Johnny Dankworth

Former swimmer: married to sprinter Derek Redmond, 1994–2000

Sharron Davies

Second wife (of three) was Sandra Dickinson, 1978–94

Peter Davison

Married to American actress, writer and director Rebecca Miller, daughter of playwright Arthur Miller, since 1996. They have two sons (Ronan b. 1998 and Cashel b. 2002)

Daniel Day–Lewis

Married to actor Michael Williams, from 1971 until his death in 2001

Judi Dench

Married Jennifer Saunders in 1985

Adrian Edmondson

Married to Paula Abdul, 1992–4; partner of Demi Moore, 1986–7

Emilio Estevez

Roy Rogers's acting partner, and his third wife (from 1947 until his death in 1998)

Dale Evans

Married to British tennis player John Lloyd (1979–87), US Olympic skier Andy Mill (1988–2006), Australian golfer Greg Norman (2008–9)

Chris Evert

Married to David A. Stewart (of Eurythmics), 1987–96

Siobhan Fahey

John Dunbar, the artist and co–founder of the gallery where John Lennon and Yoko Ono first met, was the first of three husbands of

Marianne Faithfull

Married Frank Sinatra and Andre Previn; also had a long–term relationship with Woody Allen (and bore his only child, Satchel – now known as Ronan Farrow)

Mia Farrow

Married to John Stapleton for over 40 years (both TV journalists and presenters)

Lynn Faulds–Wood

Married to French film director Roger Vadim (1965–73), US political activist Tom Hayden (1973–90), Ted Turner, founder of CNN (1991–2001)

Jane Fonda

Married to Nanette Newman, from 1955 until his death in 2013

Bryan Forbes

Married to former Miss World Wilnelia Merced (a native of Puerto Rico, 29 years his junior) from 1983 until his death in 2017

Bruce Forsyth

Married photographer Alexandra Hedison, 2014

Jodie Foster

Married Peter Sellers (from 1977, until his death in 1980) and David Frost (1981–2)

Lynn Frederick

Married Lynn Frederick (1981–2) and Lady Carina Howard (from 1983, until his death in 2013)

David Frost

Actress who married Gary Kemp (1988–95) and Jude Law (1997–2003)

Sadie Frost

Married "comedian" Elliott Spencer, Jan 2015

Stephen Fry

Married Mickey Rooney (1942–3), Frank Sinatra (1945–6) and Artie Shaw (1951–7)

Ava Gardner

Married to Anna Gordy (elder sister of Motown founder Berry Gordy), 1961–76

Marvin Gaye

Married to Cindy Crawford, 1991–5

Richard Gere

Joan Collins's 5th husband (2002)

Percy Gibson

Mike Tyson's wife (1988–9)

Robin Givens

British rower – ranked No. 1 in the world, and an Olympic champion in 2012 and 2016: married naturalist, explorer and broadcaster Steve Backshall in 2016

Helen Glover

Married (and divorced) Alvin Stardust

Lisa Goddard

Cabinet minister and former Times columnist: married fellow Times columnist Sarah Vine (known in Private Eye as Sarah Vain), who later switched to the Daily Mail, in 2001

Michael Gove

Michael Denison's wife (from 1939) and widow

Dulcie Gray

Brian Rix's wife, and co–star in the Whitehall farces

Elspeth Gray

Married fellow athlete Jonathan (John) Bigg (1993?)

Sally Gunnell

Married Christian Horner, Warwickshire–born Team Principal of the Red Bull Formula One team, in 2015 – their first child, a son, was born in January 2017

Geri Halliwell

Married to John Thaw, from 1973 until his death in 2002

Sheila Hancock

Married to actress, singer and film producer Rita Wilson since 1988; they first met in 1981, when she appeared in an episode of the television sitcom Bosom Buddies, in which he starred, and starred together in Volunteers (1985)

Tom Hanks

Second husband (of five) was Orson Welles (1943–7)

Rita Hayworth

Johnny Depp's second wife (2015–17): an actress, whom he met while filming The Rum Diary, released in 2011

Amber Heard

Married to Dawn French, 1984–2010

Lenny Henry

Kingsley Amis's second wife (and stepmother to Martin Amis): novelist

Elizabeth Jane Howard

Actress wife of John Profumo (died in 1998)

Valerie Hobson

Married (Noelene Edwards) in 1958, aged 19; divorced in 1981, remarried in 1982, divorced in 1986; later married Linda Kozlowski, co–star of his film blockbuster (1990–2014); has five children with Noelene and one with Linda

Paul Hogan

Married to Les Dennis, 1995–2003

Amanda Holden

Married Maria Ellen Santiago on 15 August 1958 aged 21 (after proposing on their first date); died on 3 February 1959 (less than 6 months later)

Buddy Holly

Married to the singer Bobby Brown, 1992–2007 (she died in 2012 aged 48)

Whitney Houston

Charles Bronson's actress wife

Jill Ireland

Married to Lisa–Marie Presley (daughter of Elvis), 1994–6. His second wife (1996–9), and the mother of his first two children, was Deborah Jeanne (Debbie) Rowe, his dermatologist's nurse

Michael Jackson

John le Mesurier's second wife (1949–65)

Hattie Jacques

Bianca Perez Morena de Macias (1971–8), Jerry Hall (1990–9)

Mick Jagger

Married to James Bolam, with whom she co–starred in When the Boat Comes In (BBC1, 1976–81)

Susan Jameson

Married American artist and film director Andre Levitas at Hampton Court in 2014 (Welsh lyric mezzo –soprano; previously engaged to TV presenter Gethin Jones)

Katherine Jenkins

Married to German recording engineer Renate Blauel, 1984–8 (after the divorce he announced that he was not bisexual but gay). Formed a civil partnership with David Furnish on 21 December 2005 – the day after civil partnerships became legal in the UK – and married him on the ninth anniversary of the partnership (21 December 2014)

Elton John

Married to the Scottish aviation pioneer Jim Mollison, from 1932 to 1938

Amy Johnson

Second wife (1993–2020) was Marina Wheeler QC; they have 6 children

Boris Johnson

Actress, married Peter Fleming – adventurer, travel writer, and brother of Ian

Celia Johnson

Married Melanie Griffith in 1976, when he was 26 and she was 18 (having lived together for 3 years); he had starred in The Harrad Experience (1973) with her mother Tippi Hedren; divorced less than a year later; this was his third marriage. They remarried in 1989 and divorced in 1996; their daughter Dakota was born in 1989. Also had a relationship with Patti D'Arbanville (1981–5). He married socialite and nursery teacher Kelley Phleger in 1999; they are still married (in 2022) and have three children

Don Johnson

Married to actors Jonny Lee Miller (1996–9), Billy Bob Thornton (2000–3), Brad Pitt (2014–19)

Angelina Jolie

Married to Nora Barnacle for the last ten years of his life (1931–41); they had their first "romantic assignation" on 16 June 1904, and their sexually explicit letters have aroused much curiosity, fetching high prices at auction

James Joyce

Married fellow TV presenter Tess Daly in 2003 – the year before she joined Bruce Forsyth as one of the original presenters of Strictly Come Dancing

Vernon Kay

Married to Prince Rainier II of Monaco, from 1956 until her death in 1982

Grace Kelly

Married to Rebekah Wade, 2002–9 (she was Editor of The Sun, 2003–9)

Ross Kemp

Actress wife of Sir Michael Redgrave, and mother of his three children (Vanessa, Lynn and Corin)

Rachel Kempson

Married to Moira Shearer, from 1950 until her death in 2006 (he died in 2009)

Ludovic Kennedy

Married Dan Donovan (1988), Jim Kerr (1992), Liam Gallagher (1997)

Patsy Kensit

Married Chrissie Hynde (1984) and Patsy Kensit (1992)

Jim Kerr

Married the famous Russian ballerina Lydia Lopokova

John Maynard Keynes

Married to Jemima Goldsmith (daughter of Sir James), 1995–2004

Imran Khan

Tom Cruise's second wife (1990 – 2001); married New–Zealand–born country singer and guitarist Keith Urban in 2006

Nicole Kidman

Irish comedian, married television presenter Cat Deeley in 2012

Patrick Kielty

Married Elvis Costello 2003 (Canadian jazz singer and pianist)

Diana Krall

Real–estate developer who married Ivanka Trump in 2009, and became senior advisor to his father–in–law; admitted meeting Russians during and after the 2016 presidential election campaign, but denied any impropriety

Jared Kushner

Footballer, married television presenter Christine Bleakley in 2015

Frank Lampard

Loose Women anchor: also co–presents Good Morning on Fridays with Eamonn Holmes (since 2000), and married him in 2010

Ruth Langsford

Husband of actress Elsa Lanchester

Charles Laughton

Actor who married Sadie Frost and also had a child with Sienna Miller

Jude Law

Married to Eric Thompson from 1957 until his death from a heart attack in 1982, aged 53 (and mother of Emma Thompson)

Phyllida Law

Married Charles Saatchi in 2003, after the death of her first husband (journalist John Diamond) from throat cancer in 2001; they divorced in 2013 after pictures were published of him holding her by the throat at a table outside a London restaurant, in what he described as a "playful tiff" but which resulted in him being cautioned for assault and her leaving home

Nigella Lawson

Princess Anne's second husband (1992)

Tim Lawrence

Pamela Anderson (1995–8)

Tommy Lee

First and most famous of Tony Curtis's six wives (1951–62); he was the second and most famous of her three husbands, and they were the parents of Jamie Lee Curtis

Janet Leigh

Married Cynthia Powell on 23 August 1962 (divorced in 1968)

John Lennon

Austrian actress and singer (1898–1981): married composer Kurt Weill in 1926, divorced in 1933; remarried in 1937, he died in 1950; married US actor George Davis in 1951, he died in 1957; married (obscure) artist Russell Detwiler in 1962, he died in 1969 aged 44 (she was 71)

Lotte Lenya

Olympic gold medallist: married Steve Finan O'Connor (son of comedian Tom O'Connor, manager of former One Direction member Liam Payne, and former manager of the pop group All Saints) in 2006

Denise Lewis

American singer: married his 13–year–old first cousin once removed, in 1957, when he was 22 and had already been married twice

Jerry Lee Lewis

Married to playwright Jack Rosenthal, from 1974 until his death in 2004

Maureen Lipman

Mildred Davies: wife and co–star (in Safety Last, 1923) of

Harold Lloyd

Married Clark Gable in March 1939 – died in a plane crash in January 1942

Carole Lombard

Married to Kurt Cobain, from 1992 until his suicide in 1994

Courtney Love

Married to Sean Penn (1985–9), Guy Ritchie (2000–8)

Madonna

Graca Machel, the widow of former Mozambican president Samora Machel, was the third wife of

Nelson Mandela

Married to the actor and producer Trevor Engelson from 2011 to 2013

Meghan Markle

Married to Gwyneth Paltrow from 2003 to 2016

Chris Martin

French–born actor: married Halle Berry in 2013 (previously dated Kylie Minogue)

Olivier Martinez

Married Anita Dobson, 2000

Brian May

Jill Ireland's first husband

David McCallum

Married Linda Eastman in 1969 (she died in 1988), Heather Mills in 2002 (divorced in 2008), Nancy Shevell in 2011

Paul McCartney

Married to Susan George, from 1984 until his death in 2010 (actor – Falcon Crest, Casualty, etc.)

Simon MacCorkindale

Married to the actress Tatum O'Neal, 1988–94 (tennis star)

John McEnroe

Mrs. Paul Daniels

Debbie McGee

Singer: married former World Superbike Champion James Toseland, in 2012

Katie Melua

Married to the actor Hywel Bennett, 1970–88; 'in a relationship' with singer Michael Ball, from 1992 (TV presenter, prominent in the 1960s)

Cathy McGowan

Second husband (since 1998) is quantum chemist and university professor Joachim Sauer

Angela Merkel

Married the comedian Sarah Parkinson, three months before her death from cancer in 2003 (she was his second wife; they were 'unofficially' married in the Maldives in 2000)

Paul Merton

Married Justine Thornton QC, a former child actress, in 2011

Ed Miliband

Tessa Jowell's second husband (from 1979) – international corporate lawyer, acted for Silvio Berlusconi and investigated in Italy for money laundering and tax fraud

David Mills

Married to Mary Hayley Bell (actress and writer) from 1941 until his death in 2005 aged 97 – she died 8 months later, aged 94

John Mills

Fourth husband was David Gest (2002–7)

Liza Minnelli

Jim Dougherty (1942, when she was aged 16 yrs 18 days; they divorced in 1946)

Marilyn Monroe

Baseball player Joe di Maggio (1954; she filed for divorce in October 1954) Playwright Arthur Miller (1956; they divorced in Mexico in 1961) Wife of Jonathan Dimbleby: writer

Bel Mooney

Married to Bruce Willis 1987–2000, Ashton Kutcher 2005–15

Demi Moore

First two marriages (of four) were to actresses Suzy Kendall (1968–72) and Tuesday Weld (1975–80)

Dudley Moore

British actress: married (since 2012) to singer, songwriter and group leader Marcus Mumford

Carey Mulligan

Wendi Deng (1999–2013) was the third wife, and Jerry Hall (2016–) the fourth, of

Rupert Murdoch

Married Julia Lemigova in New York in 2014 (former tennis star)

Martina Navratilova

Joan Collins's second husband (1963–70 – English actor, singer and songwriter)

Anthony Newley

'The Great Dane' – married to Sylvester Stallone, 1985–7

Brigitte Nielsen

Barbara Hepworth's second husband

Ben Nicholson

Diplomat, diarist etc., married to the writer Vita Sackville–West

Harold Nicolson

Married to actresses Jill Esmond (1930–40), Vivien Leigh (1940–60), and Joan Plowright from 1961 until his death in 1989

Laurence Olivier

Married to John McEnroe, 1986–92

Tatum O'Neal

British portrait photographer, active in the 1960s, who had a long–term relationship with Faye Dunaway; they were married from 1983 to 1987, and had a son, born in 1980, who he later claimed was adopted (which she denied); he died in 2019, aged 81

Terry O'Neill

Madonna's first husband (US actor – 1985–9)

Sean Penn

Played Carla in Cheers; married Danny de Vito

Rhea Perlman

American equestrian Sandy Pflueger is the second wife of (they married in 1997 and separated in 2012)

Mark Phillips

Married to Olga Khokhlova (from 1918 until her death in 1955) and Jacqueline Roque (from 1961 until his death in 1973)

Pablo Picasso

Married Jessica Taylor, formerly of the pop group Liberty X (formed by the five losing finalists from Popstars, 2001; split May 2007), Dec 2007

Kevin Pietersen

Married to actress Vivien Merchant (1956–80) and writer Antonia Fraser (from 1980 until his death in 2008)

Harold Pinter

Pop singer and actress: married to Chris Evans 2001–7, married actor Laurence Fox (DS James Hathaway in Lewis) in 2007

Billie Piper

Married to Jennifer Aniston 2000–5, and Angelina Jolie from 2014

Brad Pitt

Poet: first wife of Ted Hughes, but committed suicide

Sylvia Plath

Film producer, married to Sophia Loren from 1966 until his death in 2007

Carlo Ponti

Scottish TV presenter: married to Dan Hipgrove, the guitarist in Toploader, from 2001 to 2004

Gail Porter

Actor – married Barbara 'Babs' Lord, out of Pan's People, in 1975

Robert Powell

Married to Michael Jackson 1994–6, and Nicolas Cage 2002–4 (the second and third of her four husbands); she died in 2023

Lisa Marie Presley

Married to Peter Andre (2005–9), martial artist/kickboxer Alex Reid (2010–11), builder Kieran Hayler (2013)

Katie Price (f.k.a. Jordan)

Married to Australian actress Coral Browne, from 1974 until her death in 1991 (he died in 1993)

Vincent Price

Married That's Life presenter Paul Heiney in 1980

Libby Purves

Paul Merton's first wife (1990–8)

Caroline Quentin

Jean Michel Jarre's wife

Charlotte Rampling

Married to TV producer Desmond Wilcox, from 1977 until his death in 2000

Esther Rantzen

Bruce Forsyth's assistant on The Generation Game, and the second of his three wives (1973–9) – they started an affair during his first marriage, and he'd already divorced his first wife when the series started

Anthea Redfern

English actress: married to the Italian actor Franco Nero, since 2006 (they also had a son together in 1969)

Vanessa Redgrave

Laurie Anderson, who had a UK No. 2 hit in 1981 with O Superman, was the third wife (from 2008 until his death in 2013) of

Lou Reed

Married model / lap dancer Nancy Sorrell, 2003

Vic Reeves

Married her 4th husband, painter and decorator John Burns – her partner of 12 years, and 20 years her junior – 4 months before her death from cancer, aged 65, in February 2009

Wendy Richard

Two members of Great Britain's women's hockey team, who married in 2013: in 2016 they became the first same–sex married couple to win Olympic gold as part of the same team, and the first British married couple to do so since 1920

Helen Richardson

Kate Walsh

English film director: married Madonna at Skibo Castle, near Dornoch, Sutherland, 2000 (divorced 2008)

Guy Ritchie

Mexican painter, married to Frida Kahlo (another Mexican painter) from 1929 to 1939 and from 1940 until her death in 1954

Diego Rivera

Married to country singer Lyle Lovett, 1993–5

Julia Roberts

Actress who married Alan Dobie and Rex Harrison

Rachel Roberts

Married eight times; first wife was Ava Gardner (1942–3 – before she was famous); his fifth wife was murdered along with her lover, a Serbian–born actor, stunt double and bodyguard (or he shot her and then himself) in 1966; his eighth marriage (1978) lasted longer than all the others put together, but they separated in 2012 and legally separated in 2014; he died in April 2014, aged 93

Mickey Rooney

Singer in Guns 'n' Roses: married to Erin, the daughter of Don Everly, from April 1990 to January 1991 – he wrote Sweet Child o' Mine for her

W. Axl Rose

Wife of Leonard Cheshire VC

Sue Ryder

US poker player and "celebutant": famous for marriages to actresses Elizabeth Daily (1995–2000), Shannon Doherty (2002–3) and Pamela Anderson (2007–08; 2014–2015)

Rick Salomon

Married model and singer Carla Bruni, Jan 2008 (French president)

Nicolas Sarkozy

Clara Wieck: concert pianist, wife of

Robert Schumann

Married television journalist Maria Shriver, niece of the late President John F. Kennedy (daughter of his sister Eunice), in 1986 – separated 2011 after he admitted fathering a child 14 years earlier with a long–serving member of their household staff

Arnold Schwarzenegger

British soul singer: married to German model Heidi Klum, 2005–14

Seal

Married Anne Howe, Britt Ekland, Miranda Quarry and Lynn Frederick

Peter Sellers

Bandleader who married Lana Turner and Ava Gardner

Artie Shaw

Oscar–nominated actress: married to Stewart Granger, 1950–60

Jean Simmons

Married to Peggy Harper (the ex–wife of his former manager – 1969–75), Carrie Fisher (1983–4) and Edie Brickell (since 1992)

Paul Simon

Married to (i) his childhood sweetheart Nancy Barbato, 1939–51; (ii) Ava Gardner, 1951–7; (iii) Mia Farrow, 1966–68; (iv) Barbara Marx (née Blakeley), the former wife of Zeppo Marx, from 1976 until his death in 1998

Frank Sinatra

Married Rolling Stone Bill Wyman in 1989, when she was 19 and he was 46 (they had started dating in 1983); divorced in 1991

Mandy Smith

Sarah Greene married

Mike Smith

Married to childhood friend Jason Alexander for 55 hours, in 2004; married to Kevin Federline 2004–7; he is the father of her (first) two children

Britney Spears

Welsh singer, married to Roger Moore 1953–61 (when they married, he was 26 and she was 38)

Dorothy Squires

Second and third wives were Brigitte Nielsen (1985–7) and Jennifer Flavin (from 1997)

Sylvester Stallone

Married Nicholas Ball (star of the TV series Hazell – ITV, 1978–9) and Billy Connolly (1992–)

Pamela Stephenson

Married to Alana Hamilton (ex–wife of US actor George Hamilton – Love at First Bite, Zorro the Gay Blade – 1979–84), Rachel Hunter (New–Zealand–born actress and model – 1990–2006), Penny Lancaster (English model – 2007–). Also had relationships with Britt Ekland (1975–7) and Kelly Emberg (1983–90), and has eight children by five different mothers: one with a fellow–student when he was 18, two with each wife, and one with Emberg

Rod Stewart

Married actress Trudie Styler in 1992

Sting

Married actor James Brolin in 1998; previously (1963–71) married to Elliott Gould

Barbra Streisand

Married to fellow singer–songwriter Carly Simon, from 1972 to 1983

James Taylor

Married Margaret Kempson in 1942 and Margaret Roberts in 1951

Dennis Thatcher

Married to Diane Burgdorf, 1987–2005, and Sarah–Jane Russell (née Clemence – sister–in–law of Lord Rothermere) since 2008

Mark Thatcher

Married to Kenneth Branagh 1989–95, Greg Wise 2003–

Emma Thompson

US actress, married British actor Gary Oldman (1990–2) and US actor Ethan Hawke (1998–2004)

Uma Thurman

Married American actress Jessica Biel, 2012

Justin Timberlake

England rugby footballer, married Zara Phillips July 011

Mike Tindall

Married since 1991 to actress and former model Kelly Preston (Mischief 1985, Twins 1988, Jerry Maguire 1996)

John Travolta

Married to former Radio 1 DJ (and Top of the Pops presenter) Peter Powell (1990–8), and to Grant Bovey (2000–15)

Anthea Turner

Girls Aloud member, married England footballer Ashley Cole in 2006; second husband (July 2014) is French restaurateur and nightclub owner Jean–Bernard Fernandez–Versini

Cheryl Tweedy

French film director: first husband of both Brigitte Bardot (1952–7) and Jane Fonda (1965–73) – also Catherine Deneuve had a son by him in 1963

Roger Vadim

Mandy Smith's second husband, after Bill Wyman (Everton footballer)

Pat van den Hauwe

Celebrity chef, married to Fern Britton (same name as an England rugby player who, bizarrely, won Celebrity Masterchef in 2011!)

Phil Vickery

Natalie Wood's husband, 1957–62 and from 1972 until her death in 1981; married former Bond girl Jill St. John, 1990

Robert Wagner

Married Dutch model Lara Stone, 2010

David Walliams

Actress – played Doctor Who's assistant Romana, 1979–81: married to Tom Baker 1980–2, and Richard Dawkins from 1992 (separated in 2016)

(The Hon.) Lalla Ward

Married four times; his second wife (1977–87), and the mother of his two daughters (including EastEnders actress Hannah Waterman), was actress Patricia Maynard; his third wife (1987–98) was actress Rula Lenska

Dennis Waterman

Married Daniel Craig, 2011

Rachel Weisz

Married (1985–1988) to actor David Easter (Brookside, Emmerdale, Hollyoaks) and (1988–2002) to Tim Healy (Auf Wiedersehen Pet, Benidorm, etc.)

Denise Welch

American actress: married to Dudley Moore (1975–80) and to Israeli violinist Pinchas Zuckerman (1985–98)

Tuesday Weld

Second wife (of three) was Rita Hayworth (1943–7)

Orson Welles

US rapper: married Kim Kardashian in 2014

Kanye West

Married to Prunella Scales since 1963

Timothy West

Pop singer (greatest success in the early to mid–eighties), married to Robert Fripp (best known as the guitarist and leader of the progressive rock group King Crimson) since 1986

Toyah Willcox

Married the American actress Ayda Field in 2010 (after they'd been in a relationship since 2006)

Robbie Williams

Married Alexis Ohanian, co–founder and executive chairman of the social news website Reddit, in 2017

Serena Williams
